description-section: Responsibilities   Provide HR support and consultation to our Googler and Manager clients, answering employee and manager questions about HR programs, policies, and other HR-related items. Advise on performance management issues and lead minor investigations and reorganizations. Assist People Partners with planning and roll-out of HR programs and initiatives. Triage Googler enquiries via our internal systems and connect Googlers to the right subject-matter expert when necessary. Identify opportunities to improve HR policies by gaining insights across multiple experiences of Googlers/Managers. Identify and propose solutions to correct inconsistent HR policies and gaps.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of HR Business Partner or generalist experience. Preferred qualifications: MBA or Master's degree. Demonstrated experience with cross-functional collaboration and influencing stakeholders. Client-service experience with a strong focus on delivering exceptional customer service. Effective interpersonal, teamwork and organizational skills.
description-section text with-benefits: People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made. In this role, you will deliver solutions to HR Business Partners (HRBPs) and clients seamlessly. You will be responsible for coaching clients, navigating and resolving employee relations issues, and managing programs that help to develop our Googlers. You will use your communication, organization and collaboration skills on a global scale with a wide variety of stakeholders. You will also work closely with the HRBPs and liaise with other functions (e.g. communications, etc) and stakeholders across Google.Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
title: People Consultant

description-section: Responsibilities   Drive value proposition and strategy across proprietary and third-party Reach/GRP measurement solutions, leveraging them to articulate the value of Google. Work with internal solutions, i.e Brand Lift, unique reach, GRPs, TRPs, and external solutions with 3P, i.e Sales lift, Viewability, MMM. Lead Brand measurement solutions including working with Large Customer Sales team (LCS), Public Relations team, executives, and other product management team members. Lead these conversations as a referent. Influence go-to-market teams to shape Spanish speaking countries in Latin America (SPLA) objectives and key results (OKRs) and activation plans for our sales teams in order to help our customers make Google a core part of their marketing plans based on measurement solutions to prove Google's contribution to brand Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in digital advertising sales, product marketing or product management. 3 years of experience in market research and measurement, and project management experience. Experience in digital branding and Google’s measurement products and consultative sales. Client-facing experience. Preferred qualifications: MBA degree. Agency/Brand advertiser experience or experience servicing agencies. Working knowledge of brand advertiser needs, KPIs and digital marketing plans. Organized self-starter with ability to manage multiple projects from inception to completion. Demonstrated ability to manage highly strategic and difficult business problems. Ability to create influential relationships and work in a cross-functional, team matrixed environment. Oral and written communications skills across internal and external stakeholders.
description-section text with-benefits: Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Together with the Americas team, you´ll be responsible for all YouTube solutions that aim to have a platform that is suitable for our advertisers and aligned with their brand values. The Brand Measurement vision is to partner with industry leading third-party measurement companies and build proprietary solutions that assess brand impact of advertising in Google products. This role is focused on third-party (i.e Viewabilty, Sales Lift, Media Mix Modeling (MMM)), as well as Google-owned solutions to measure post-campaign Brand Lift Survey, Reach, Frequency, GRP and TRP metrics.  You are a strong specialist with deep knowledge of brand advertiser marketing objectives and possess the ability to bridge cross-functional teams, and drive our products’ value proposition. You will work to drive business growth through the identification of relevant opportunities, finding creative solutions that support our clients in measuring the success of their advertising campaigns. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build strong businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.
title: Brand Measurement and Safety Specialist, PSS SPLatAm

description-section: Responsibilities   Specific responsibilities vary by project area.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Currently enrolled in a 4 year Bachelor's degree program, majoring, or intending to major, in Computer Science or a closely related field at a university in the same country/region of the session to which you are applying. Must be in your second year of education. Preferred qualifications: Programming experience in either Java, Python, C, or C++.
description-section text with-benefits: Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our search engine and tools serve. We believe that, in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.  Google is invested in increasing the pipeline of future computer scientists and software developers, particularly those who are historically underrepresented in the field. Many aspiring computer scientists could benefit from a program that bridges the gap between academic study and a professional internship. We want to inspire these students to continue in the field with this program.  With this in mind, Google is pleased to announce that the 2018 Engineering Practicum internship program will now be open to university students currently in their second year, majoring, or intending to major in, Computer Science or a related subject. This program includes three main components: a software project, skills-based training and professional development.  This internship program includes: Software Project: A three-month development project that you will work on with a team of Googlers and other Engineering Practicum interns. Skills-Based Training: Enhance your coding skills, and gain exposure to new tools and programming languages. Professional Development: Attend ongoing technical talks by senior Googlers. Additionally, learn how to enhance your resume, tackle technical interviews, and improve your presentation skills. Mentorship: Be matched with a Google engineer, other than your manager, who will guide you through your summer experience. Fun: Participate in social activities, community building and networking. Build relationships with your peers. Exposure: Gain a unique glimpse into applying your computer science studies in a professional environment.Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
title: Engineering Practicum Intern 2018

description-section text with-benefits: Nest Cam’s Integration Engineering team is looking for strong test engineers to lead all aspects of new product and feature qualification from concept to post-release monitoring to ensure we quickly ship features that delight customers. Engineers in the role will have the opportunity to gain a breadth of understanding about what makes Nest’s camera products tick. Specifically you will be responsible for testing the embedded systems that rely on sensors, machine learning and cloud connectivity. The ideal candidate has a strong background in low-level and system/test development for embedded devices and has worked on or tested camera firmware.  The work:  Review new features at design and implementation time for compatibility with existing features, feasibility of implementation, testability, test coverage and monitorability  Develop and drive sustainable test plans that account for new and legacy products  Automate tests for an embedded software system to cover new and existing features, focusing on hermetic, stable, and fast tests that maximize code and feature coverage and factor in user behavior, environmental variation, and manufacturing tolerances  Identify key product indicators to monitor once software has been shipped to customers  Drive requirements with adjacent engineering teams for tools that automatically gather and expose key product indicators for new features  Root-cause test failures and indicator changes, identifying responsible teams and driving quick resolution of product, infrastructure, and environment issues  Maintain database of test cases both existing and future with thoroughness and consistency  Minimum qualifications:  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent practical experience  3+ year’s experience with software application testing and test automation  3+ year’s experience with UNIX, Linux, or OS X  3+ year’s experience with Python, Ruby, or Perl  3+ year’s experience with C or C++  Strong test plan and test case writing skills  Preferred qualifications:  A master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent practical experience  3+ year’s of experience with pdb or similar debugging tools  3+ year’s of experience testing clients of RESTful web services  5+ year’s of experience with software application testing and test automation  5+ year’s of experience with UNIX, Linux, or OS X  5+ year’s of experience with Python  Demonstrate good coding style and practices  Understanding of sensor technologies, filtering/sensing algorithms, and validation techniques  Strong ability to multi-task and prioritize  Strong time management skills  Detail oriented and able to work independently  Strong organizational skills *LI-DNI
title: Test Engineer, Embedded Software - Nest Camera

Identify and implement technical solutions to efficiently scale our support model. Build relationships with internal and external partners to better understand and support use of our tools. Analyze and monitor key metrics to drive request prioritization and issue resolution.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience with Python and/or Go, JavaScript and HTML. Experience with web application development. Preferred qualifications: Practical Machine Learning experience. Experience in building customer service infrastructure. Knowledge of building efficient user interfaces with JavaScript frameworks. Strong algorithmic and data structure knowledge with practical applications. A passion for providing excellent customer support. Strong communication skills and ability to work independently.
description-section text with-benefits: With the Google Access team, you’ll work on cross-product and cross-team initiatives, working closely with cross-functional team members to refine and evolve our projects, as well as deploy new technologies to markets and communities around the globe. You like being on-the-ground, executing complex projects that bring internet access to people. Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speed to the home. As a Customer Service Tools Developer, you will design and build the necessary tools and solutions to enable our team to effectively support our customers. You will be an expert in our products and services, and you will provide both specific and broad solutions for our customers. You will work directly with cross-functional teams such as Engineering and Product to gather requirements to improve and innovate our service delivery. At Access, our mission is to create abundant internet on networks that are always fast and always open. Google Fiber provides superfast Internet to homes in 9 metro areas across the U.S. We want to bring Google Fiber to customers even faster, so we’re focused on making deployment more efficient and less intrusive.

description-section: Responsibilities   Consult with team Leaders to create a comprehensive people plan in order to influence lasting change over large functions at Google; act as a trusted advisor and coach to leadership, and play a critical role in enhancing their effectiveness. Manage people-related initiatives with your communication, coaching and influencing skills, and offer thought-leadership regarding organizational/people-related strategy and execution; provide insightful data to guide decision making and provide proactive solutions. Ensure that the organization is structured in a way that helps achieve business objectives; manage talent effectively to ensure we have the right people in the right roles while enabling leaders to cultivate an effective leadership pipeline. Set the strategy for People Operations programs; educate clients on various HR initiatives including learning and development, recognition programs, reorganizations and various management issues. Partner closely with functional People Partners and People Operations colleagues to deliver services to client groups; address and manage a broad spectrum of employee relations matters, and work to resolve them through a systematic approach, adhering to company policies, local employment laws and best practices.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience working as a Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) or generalist and/or experience in relevant Human Resources disciplines. Experience in an Operational or and Project Management role (e.g., managing site wide/organizational projects and initiatives). Preferred qualifications: Master of Business Administration or Master's degree. Experience in Management Consultation, working with external clients. A combination of HR experience in the following areas: organizational design, succession planning, performance management, diversity and inclusion, business consulting, coaching and development, talent management, data analysis and employee relations. Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze data, understand trends and develop recommendations for action based on the analysis. Effective consultation and coaching skills, with the ability to build relationships with leaders, and a complex set of stakeholders, in order to drive organizational change.

description-section: Responsibilities   Identify opportunities for staffers to build their understanding of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Partner with PeopleDev, LearningNav, and EDII to design a development journey, through the lens of diversity, equity, and inclusion, for the full staffer lifecycle. This includes both standalone trainings and integration of diversity, equity, inclusion mindsets, language and principles into all existing and new staffer trainings. Partner with EDII and the Hiring Innovation team to ensure the diversity, equity, and inclusion related content in staffing trainings is aligned with interviewer training to promote common language and mindsets. Ensure the resources designed to support staffer development (FAQ docs, candidate talking points, etc.) stay relevant and are well socialized.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience in learning and development. 1 year of experience in the diversity, equity or inclusion space or with related projects. Preferred qualifications: Experience building a training roadmap, specifically in the diversity and inclusion space. Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. Ability to influence across multiple teams. Demonstrated high attention to detail and strong operational expertise.
description-section text with-benefits: Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google. As a Staffing Content Specialist focused on diversity, equity and inclusion, you will leverage your knowledge of learning and development best practices and exceptional execution skills to ensure our staffing organization is equipped to build a truly diverse and inclusive Google. In this specialist role, you will partner with members of the Staffing organization, PeopleDev (our Learning and Development organization), and EDII (Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and Integrity team) to ensure that staffers have access to the relevant trainings and resources, and are developing their own expertise to become practitioners of inclusive sourcing and hiring practices. Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
title: Staffing Content Specialist, Diversity and Inclusion

Implement and optimize OEM and carrier co-marketing programs in collaboration with the Platforms and Ecosystems team. Develop global retail strategy to showcase the Google Assistant experience and device ecosystem. Partner with Sales and Product Management teams to design and launch new retail and OEM incentive programs and promotions. Manage a team of Product Marketers. description-section text with-benefits: Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Google Assistant aims to make it radically simpler for people to find information and get things done throughout their day on a wide variety of devices made by many different manufacturers, in addition to Google’s own devices. As a Co-Marketing and Retail Lead, you'll help make third-party device manufacturers successful through Google Assistant, and drive engaged users of Google Assistant.  Specifically, as a Co-Marketing and Retail Lead, you'll set global strategy for partner marketing opportunities with device Original Equipment Manufacturers and mobile carriers, and drive retail experiences that bring the Google Assistant ecosystem to life, including Google’s devices, third-party devices, and smart home devices with Google Assistant integration. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
title: OEM Retail Marketing Lead, Google Assistant

Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Creative Writing or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience as a writer for consumers. Experience writing dialogue for plays/screenplays, fiction/interactive fiction, and/or comedy/entertainment. Ability to speak and write fluently and idiomatically in Japanese. description-section text with-benefits: The Google Doodle team is all fun and games. We are on a mission to find the right person to join our talented team of characters who are creating some fun for the Google Assistant. You have previously written for a character for film, TV, video game, or comic book and can deliver a joke that can make anyone smile or you're the person at the party who wins the trivia contest because you can finish the fun film quote or recite obscure music lyrics.  The Google Assistant Personality team is dedicated to bringing a bit of fun and a human touch to people interacting with the Google Assistant through chat, phones, TVs, watches, Google Home and other devices we haven’t even thought of yet. As a Creative Writer, you will work closely with international Creative Leads in adapting the Google Assistant persona for your region. You will be writing dialogue and curating a wide range of content including jokes, quotes, fun facts and games making sure it all feels natural for the market.  Success will be measured both in terms of quantity (delivering a high volume of content) and quality (delivering culturally appropriate compelling content). There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started.
title: Creative Writer, Doodle Team, Google Assistant (Japanese)

description-section text with-benefits: The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Be responsible for technical aspects of solutions to include such activities as supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of supporting technical resources. Work with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI response documents. Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience. Experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).  Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in Computer Science or related technical field. Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies. Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems. Experience in data and information management, especially as it relates to Big Data trends and issues within businesses. Experience using and/or managing databases. Understanding of Map Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, SparkSQL, BigQuery. Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT space. Effective presentation skills.
description-section text with-benefits: Nest is seeking an experienced public relations professional to help build the profile of Nest’s award winning products. This is a great opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment on products that can make a positive difference in people’s lives. Experience in the technology industry, and a passion for great products is a must.  The work:  Play a major role in the research, planning and development of comprehensive public relations programs  Build and maintain strong relationships with members of the press, influencers, and key partners  Generate media outreach strategies, and execute plans thoughtfully and effectively  Create content for the Nest blog, write press releases, media pitches, and other types of content  Work cross-functionally with members of Nest’s product and engineering teams to create effective messaging to support new products and services  Minimum qualifications:  5 years of experience managing successful public relations programs  BA or BS degree  Existing relationships with key members of the press  Preferred qualifications:  Ability to effectively communicate information and ideas in written and verbal format  Adept at building and maintaining relationships  Team player, with the confidence to take the lead and execute with minimal guidance  Ability to partner with stakeholders in other departments  Strong project management and organizational skills  Experience working both in-house and at an agency a plus Social media experience a plus
title: Public Relations Manager
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India; Bengaluru, Karnataka, India; Gurugram, Haryana, India

description-section: Responsibilities   Develop strategy, concepts and tactics for our Success Online efforts across Denmark across channels. Managing relationships, building networks and ensuring that all initiatives are of consistent and high quality, and representative of the brand. Manage diverse initiatives to ensure reporting with relation to specific KPIs. Conduct ongoing outreach to local municipalities and partners to collaborate on our Growth Engine initiatives. Manage external and internal communication about the program. Work with internal stakeholders to produce Growth Engine initiatives, and work within agreed budgets to deliver end to end support for initiatives and events. Manage relationships with external agencies, production companies and vendors. Analyze programs for effectiveness; conduct post-event reporting and ROI analysis.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. Technology/online industry experience. Ability to speak and write in English and Danish fluently and idiomatically. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with non-hierarchical, cross-functional matrix teams, across numerous geographies. Event management and online marketing experience. Experience delivering multiple projects at one time in a fast-moving environment. Knowledge of online products, online marketing and an understanding of Google’s strategic position within the market. Demonstrated analytical skills and ability to develop marketing strategy, business plans and market insights. Demonstrated event execution skills and written/verbal communication skills.
description-section text with-benefits: Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. You are a flexible, hardworking marketer with demonstrable interest and understanding for Google. One of the main priorities of the role is to be in charge of positioning, packaging, and promoting Google's Growth Engine initiative, Success Online. You will engage with several public and private partners with the aim to train people in digital skills. Success Online targets small businesses, students/job seekers and on-the job trainers. The program is a truly cross functional effort between marketing, PR and Policy.  You will also work closely with external stakeholders, such as program partners, city officials and agencies. The role involves some business travel especially within the Nordics. You will consistently work on improving all existing initiatives and be ready and willing to devise and pilot new, innovative ideas. Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
title: Product Marketing Manager (PMM), Growth Engine
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India; Bengaluru, Karnataka, India; Gurugram, Haryana, India

description-section: Responsibilities   Become an expert in Shopping for Google products and the ecosystem. Feed and campaign best practices, provided product roadmaps and provide expertise on third-party platforms. Manage Shopping business growth. Lead, drive and scale product launches (e.g. LIA, Showcase, POG, etc). Provide quarterly priority activations as set by Shopping sales leadership. Continuously educate customers and clients with products and best-practices.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of experience working in digital marketing/sales. Preferred qualifications: Understanding of industry metrics and KPIs, and features and benefits of Google Shopping products. Ability to provide thought leadership and effectively lead discussions at C-Level/Director Level. Ability to deliver insights/out of sights from data that creates business value and drive client action. Proficiency using shopping related tools and resources to manage Shopping activation. Effective communication, business planning, consulting skills and sales driven motivation.
description-section text with-benefits: Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. As a Sales Specialist, you will manage Shopping account business growth by partnering with the pods and collaborating directly with clients to provide strategy, guidance, consultation, and support for Shopping campaigns, presentations and sales activation.Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build strong businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.
title: Sales Specialist, Shopping

description-section text with-benefits: Are you passionate about applying technologies that make an impact? At Nest you'll have the opportunity to shape the consumer electronics business, join a world class engineering team, and help revolutionize the next unloved device in our homes.  Nest’s Product Integration Engineering team is looking for a hands-on technical leader for our Product Integration Engineering team. The Product Integration Engineering (IE) team focus is on delivering robust customer-facing products and feature experience with best in class development practices.  The work:  Drive a team of engineers to qualify the integration of embedded software solutions onto development/production hardware architecture  Manage the development of a diverse and highly functional engineering team  Develop a scalable end-to-end test automation strategy across products, including sustainable physical and virtual infrastructure  Provide technical solutions to complex product development problems  Maintain a “data-driven” approach to critical product and technical platform decision s  Drive and support organization deliverables, including time to market and quality of product  Implement and define measurable approach to strategy and goal achievement  Provide guidance to platform stakeholders and leadership based on deep subject matter expertise  Set the initiatives for the engineering staff, and actively support the goals and objectives of the organization as a whole  Build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships platform and organization wide  Minimum qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent practical experience  5+ years of technical leadership experience  3+ years experience with a programming or scripting language (i.e. Python, C, C++)  2+ years experience with the Linux operating system and development platform  Able to thrive in a team oriented, fast paced work environment  Adept at effectively solving technical challenges in a complex environment  Excellent people and vendor management experience  Consumer electronic release and deployment experience  Preferred qualifications:  Master’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent practical experience  Passion for quality, efficiency, productivity, and infrastructure  Experience with high quality distributed systems  Experience with wireless communication protocols such as WiFi and Bluetooth  Experience with sensors and supporting algorithms  Experience with full software development release cycle  Effective communication skills to thrive in highly collaborative work environment
title: Manager - Nest Integration Engineering

description-section: Responsibilities   Monitor network performance and lead troubleshooting efforts for entire network systems (end-to-end long haul route, complete metro transport, core routing elements). Coordinate outside plant moves/changes. Prepare and implement MOPs and update network documentation based on changes in network topology Manage local technical operations staff and Vendor performance for both inside and outside plant. Develop and document field operations standards, training, and best practices. Collaborate with central, regional, and local teams to identify and develop scalable network designs, innovations and policy recommendations to improve the network and its deployment. Program manage Operations schedule, costs, and performance. Lead new Plant testing and acceptance to ensure everything is ready to give our customers the best experience possible on their new Google Fiber service. Lead metro implementation of Last Mile and Customer Installation efforts to ensure rapid deployment of Google Fiber.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in a Network Operations, Engineering, Construction and/or Maintenance role. Experience managing telecommunication infrastructure, Fiber to the Home/Plant (FTTx) operations and/or outside plant (OSP) projects. Preferred qualifications: PMP or MBA with practical experience in telecommunications industry. Experience in managing complex, cross functional projects. Demonstrate ability to grow and mature network systems and operations.
description-section text with-benefits: The Operations Manager will ensure that network operations are reliable and efficient by monitoring network performance, performing planned maintenance, proactively identifying and repairing network difficulties, and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which requires the Operations Manager to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies and processes. The Operations Manager will lead testing, acceptance, last mile and installation operations to bring Google Fiber to customers as quickly as possible. Additionally, the Operations Manager will perform critical tasks that maintain and improve network operations and will take the technical lead in ensuring a reliable and efficiently operating network. At Access, our mission is to create abundant internet on networks that are always fast and always open. Google Fiber provides superfast Internet to homes in 9 metro areas across the U.S. We want to bring Google Fiber to customers even faster, so we’re focused on making deployment more efficient and less intrusive.
title: Operations Manager, Google Fiber
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: New York, NY, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA

description-section: Responsibilities   Inspire, grow, and develop talent, while providing vision and setting direction for the team. Lead effectively through outcomes rather than tasks. Collaborate with partner teams to achieve shared objectives, to provide strategic insight, and to lead continuous improvement efforts in customer service and operations. Drive results by tracking key operational metrics, identifying process improvement opportunities and delivering on strategic initiatives. Oversee the design and operation of various cloud-based services, systems and applications. Lead hiring and career development for a team of intelligent, ambitious professionals across a variety of technical disciplines.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of technical experience as an individual contributor prior to management. Experience with Linux, OS X, Windows, networking, mobile, video conferencing and/or voice technologies. Preferred qualifications: 5 years of experience in managing a team of engineering and/or technical operations professionals responsible for critical systems and operations for a distributed organization. 5 years of experience in building and developing teams. Experience in hiring and developing suitably talented and motivated people. Experience in leading people through change while maintaining the ability to adjust to rapidly changing technology and to make decisions with limited information. Ability to prioritize and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives. Exceptional organizational, communication, leadership and customer service skills.
description-section text with-benefits: Technical support for a technology company is a big task. As the Operations Manager within the IT Support Technician team, your mission is to enable the people and technology that keep Google running. Your team provides the front line user support for all of our internal tools and technologies. Beyond the day-to-day, the team will contribute to longer-term technical projects, process improvement and the documentation efforts that help make the Google magic happen. As a Technical Operations Manager, you'll be an inspirational leader with experience in recruiting, developing and guiding a talented team of engineering and operations professionals. You'll also bring a passion for pushing the limits of technology, while also using that passion to encourage users, both large and small, to adopt cloud-based computing and mobile technologies. Additionally, you'll have a technical foundation and the flexibility, talent and aptitude to learn new technologies and to lead a variety of projects and teams across the organization.Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
title: Technical Operations Manager, Corporate Engineering
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: New York, NY, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA

description-section: Responsibilities   Become a credible and authentic technology leader, deliver the team's vision and technology to prospects, partners and customers in the region. Align the technical requirements and the solution design with the customer's business drivers and demonstrate our unique value. Hire, coach and drive a team to work towards assigned goals. Partner with the customer to develop a strong working relationship with the customer’s technical staff and be able to gain their trust and credibility through your deep technical knowledge and domain expertise. This, while working closely with geographically distributed Apigee and Customer project teams. Travel up to 50% of the time as required.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Experience in people management, coaching and growing a team of Technical Consultants. Preferred qualifications: Experience providing organizational and subject matter leadership on technical sales strategies. Ability to work across Product Marketing, Product Management, Engineering, Customer Success and Sales Management functions. Development experience using Google or other cloud products. Understanding of private, public and hybrid cloud design considerations and limitations in the areas of virtualization and global infrastructure, distributed systems, load balancing and networking and security. Ability to facilitate the development and communication of robust solutions to technical and business audiences. Excellent listening, critical thinking and analytical skills.
description-section text with-benefits: Apigee Edge is an advanced API platform that enables enterprises to create, manage, secure and scale APIs. Using Apigee, enterprises can design and deploy API proxies in public and private clouds, secure data in transit with OAuth 2.0, SAML and two-way TLS, protect against traffic spikes by adding dynamic routing, caching and rate-limiting policies to APIs, and measure the success of both API operations and API business with end-to-end analytics.As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help businesses of all sizes leverage technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. As a Solutions Architect Manager, you will coach a team of Solution Architects who engage with prospects and customers on their journey with Apigee. We're building a team that understands and can assess a customer's requirements, prepare and present demonstrations of the Apigee platform and help customers build robust production ready solutions. You'll also directly engage with customers on a regular basis independent of your team to drive customer success.Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
title: Manager, Solutions Architecture, Google Cloud (Apigee)
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Paris, France; Berlin, Germany; Munich, Germany

description-section: Responsibilities   Act as an expert for Google’s advertiser products working with internal stakeholders and clients to realize business goals in the market and to identify new business opportunities. Engage with cross-functional partners globally to manage projects, resolve issues and drive business and operations forward. Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service through your own efforts and through working with vendors and internal partners to drive internal operations to meet efficiency, speed and CSAT goals. Understand requirements and communicate complex information and solutions relating to applying ad products and technologies. Lead and motivate others around you, being mindful of global inclusivity.   Qualifications  Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 4 years of work experience in operations, customer experience or consulting in a relevant industry. Experience managing multiple global projects simultaneously. Preferred qualifications: MBA or MS degree. 4 years of experience in digital ad operations or experience in the online advertising industry. Experience with the ad serving industry and internet technologies. Experience with SQL databases and dashboard creation or experience with one object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, Python, etc.). Experience working with vendors and global teams. Proven communication, creative problem-solving and strong analytical skills on complex topics.
description-section text with-benefits: Google Technical Services: Professional Services (gPS) is a team of solution-oriented trusted advisors supporting millions of users worldwide. Our consultative services take our deep technical and product expertise and combine it with our powerful understanding of our customer’s needs and goals to solve their biggest business challenges allowing them to grow and get the most out of Google solutions. Behind every advertising campaign at Google are systems to make it run. Behind those systems are Googlers who advise and partner with our users and customers. As an Advertiser Solutions Consultant you will support vendors, sales, and our customers with your AdWords implementation and scaled operations expertise. Your stakeholders will look to your expertise on product configuration and business processes, combining your deep understanding of Google Ads products with industry best practices and operations.Google Technical Services is a global support and operations team, with a mission to delight our customers with care so good, it’s got to be Google. Our team is the face of Google to most of our customers, and we want their Google support experience to set new standards, just like Google’s products do. Our team cares for customers by solving problems and scaling solutions, incubating new Google products, and sharing user feedback with internal teams to influence product development. We support a wide variety of products, from Ads to Project Fi and just about everything in between, and our customers include advertisers, consumers, partners, publishers, retailers, and our own Sales Googlers.
title: AdWords Campaign Solution Specialist, Google Professional Services
description-section text: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: New York, NY, USA; Boulder, CO, USA
